key_gaps: Integration between Men's and Women's digital ecosystems
Legacy CRM infrastructure (assumed based on club age)

quick_actions.action: Map decision-making structure for the Women's team digital strategy

key_insights.insight: Entity is explicitly identified as part of the Barclays Women's Super League (WSL), indicating a strategic focus on women's football growth which often requires separate, agile digital infrastructures.
Absence of hypothesis signals suggests limited prior engagement or publicly available digital maturity data, requiring a 'Cold Start' discovery approach.

budget_indicators.indicator: Active participation in Barclays WSL implies central funding and commercial revenue streams requiring reinvestment in digital assets.

strategic_initiatives.description: Digital engagement and commercialization of the Women's team brand.

decision_makers.name: {HEAD_OF_DIGITAL}
decision_makers.title: Head of Digital / CDO
decision_makers.responsibility_scope: Overall digital strategy, fan data, ticketing platforms

influence_network.decision_process: Formal RFP or Direct Award depending on spend

urgency_indicators.indicator: WSL League growth requires immediate digital scaling to keep up with viewership demands.

implementation_risks.risk: Long procurement cycles due to club size
implementation_risks.mitigation: Engage early with advisory content, not sales pitches

immediate_actions.action: Deep scrape Arsenal official site and WSL sub-pages for tech stack clues (Google Tag Manager, CMS footprints).
immediate_actions.success_criteria: List of identified technologies and vendors
immediate_actions.hypothesis_to_test: Tech stack is fragmented between Men's and Women's teams

primary_hypothesis.statement: Arsenal FC is actively seeking to upgrade its Women's team digital infrastructure but is constrained by legacy systems designed for the Men's team.
primary_hypothesis.validation_strategy: Analyze job postings for 'Women's Football' specific digital roles and review recent press releases for 'Digital Transformation' keywords.
success_metrics: Finding 3+ job postings for digital roles specific to the Women's team
Identifying a new vendor partnership announcement in the last 6 months

secondary_hypotheses.statement: The club uses separate CRM instances for Men and Women, creating a data integration opportunity.

resource_allocation.technical_preparation: Prepare 'Women's Sports Digital Maturity' benchmark report
resource_allocation.partnership_leverage: Leverage existing WSL contacts if available

monitoring_triggers.signal: New 'Digital' or 'CRM' related job postings specifically mentioning Women's Football
Announcement of new stadium or training ground facilities for Women's team

data_gaps.importance: Critical to avoid pitching to an incumbent partner
data_gaps.collection_method: Source from 'AdAge' or 'Campaign' archives, or inspect source code meta tags
Inspect network traffic or privacy policy documents

engagement_sequence.action: Connect with Digital Directors on LinkedIn
